revised_title: Epitope Recognition and T Cell Regulation in Lactate Dehydrogenase B Immune Response
tldr: The authors discovered that two adjacent epitopes on a synthetic dodecapeptide induce lactate dehydrogenase B-specific helper and suppressor T cells. They found that both helper and suppressor T cells recognize the 211-222 stretch of the LDH-B sequence, but have different fine specificities. This finding supports two possible mechanisms of suppression: bridging of helper and suppressor T cells by antigen and subsequent transmission of a suppressive signal, or competition for antigen between helper and suppressor T cells.
